result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Clerk: Amy.
Case Called:  8:35 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears by video from Waupaca Co Jail with Attorney Snyder by video. 

Date and time set for bond forfeiture hearing.
**COURT quashes warrant**

COURT questions Atty Snyder re: missed appearance.  Atty Snyder makes statement; deft was incarcerated at time of missed appearance. 

COURT ORDERS bond reinstated.  

COURT sets PTC 12/05/22 at 2:15 p.m.

Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant fails to appear. 
Atty Daniel Snyder appears in person. 

Date and time set for FPT. 
Atty Snyder has no information to provide; has not had contact with deft since released from Stanley Correctional. 
State is requesting warrant. 

COURT issues $500.00 bench warrant and sets BFH 10/13/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

COURT removes JT. 

Adj:  9:02 a.m.

$1250 of $2500 bond forfeited

Clerk Shirley
Case called: 10:30
Time set for hearing on return of bond to surety
State appears by ADA Patrick McMenamin, Defendant does not appear. Surety Wendy Rogowski appears. with Atty Gardner.

Atty McMenamin asks that the bond be forfeited because of the defendants continued burglaries.  Atty Gardner argues that the surety cannot predict the defendants behavior. Defendant is in custody in Lincoln Co at this time so he is available for court appearances.

Court finds that there was a motion filed previously to forfeit bond because of a burglary.  Atty McMenamin asks to take up that motion now.  Court questions surety as to why she posted for an acquaintance.
Arguments.

Court orders:  Half of bond forfeited in the amount of $1250.00 and the balance to be returned to surety.

OTR: 3:10pm for parties/COURT to review.
BOTR: 3:17pm -- COURT notes there are rulings from both Taylor and Clark counties, and matters 

COURT questions Atty Anderson re: speedy trial demand set to begin next week; Atty Anderson states defendant is waiving speedy trial, State does not object, and COURT accepts the waiver of speedy trial to remove the JT set at this time to begin next week 11/30.

COURT questions Atty Anderson re: request for additional evidence versus review of transcripts from 2 counties - Atty Anderson requests until next week
COURT orders Atty Anderson to advise court by 12/8 regarding additional testimony, state to file any formal objection by 12/22, and COURT will issue ruling by 1/31.

COURT directs parties to set Motion to Modify Bond on 12/1 at a time to be determined by JA at the conclusion of this hearing.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:31pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Goetz
(Motion to Suppress and FPT)

COURT notes State has filed Motions that appear standard and questions Atty Goetz regarding any argument.
Atty Goetz notes there may be several DVDs from several jurisdictions  that are needed as part of discovery on a collateral estoppel issue; State notes many letters sent to each jurisdiction regarding information relating to burglaries but those may not have been construed as relating to the traffic stop, and will follow up with all to obtain any DVDs or CDs.
COURT holds open all other motions filed until videos/DVDs are obtained; COURT removes JT from calendar.

Atty Goetz has 30 days to obtain any additional information and file any other motions, and State has an additional 30 days to file any motions/information as well; Matter to be reset for trial in approx 3 months.
